bullets.text: Fed cuts interest rates, citing cooling inflation and softening labor market; signals data-dependent path ahead.
Fed’s September projections show inflation easing and growth slowing, implying gradual further easing over coming meetings.
New Fed Governor Miran dissents, urging a 50 bp cut; rest of FOMC backs smaller move.
Mortgage refinance applications jump nearly 60% as rates drop sharply post-Fed.
Global equities mixed after Fed; Japan’s Nikkei hits record while U.S. stocks struggle for direction.
China reportedly bans purchases of Nvidia AI chips; Nvidia shares dip, escalating U.S.-China tech tensions.
U.S. investors and Trump administration near TikTok deal with China, potentially reshaping control and data safeguards.
Netskope prices IPO at $19; StubHub slips on debut, signaling selective appetite for listings.
Meta unveils $799 Ray-Ban Display smart glasses and new spatial computing tools, expanding wearables and AR ecosystem.
Jaguar Land Rover halts production for third week after cyberattack, highlighting industrial cyber risk and supply chain fragility.
National Academies reaffirm robust evidence that greenhouse gases pose major risks, countering political skepticism.
Researchers reverse stroke damage using stem cells in early studies, pointing to potential new therapies.
Soil warming experiments suggest stronger long-term carbon release from soils than models assume, challenging climate projections.
DOJ sues Rhode Island over race-based student loan forgiveness program, testing limits of targeted debt relief.
